head.title: COVID-10 (Coronavirus) Information/Resources - For Parents/Students - Reading Community City School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: Reading Community School District is located in Reading , OH.

div.style: color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

span.style: font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: BUILDING TO REMAIN CLOSED THROUGH END OF ACADEMIC YEAR

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: On April 20, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine ordered that all of Ohioâs K-12 school buildings remain closed to students for the remainder of the academic year due to the COVID-19 health crisis.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Although our school buildings are to remain closed, remote learning will continue through the remainder of the school year. We

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: will continue to adjust and administer our virtual learning plans and expectations, provide student services and resources to the best of our ability, and distribute free meals to our students.

p.style: color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; text-align: start; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: Reading families will have access to free meals for their children during the state-mandated closure. Carry out breakfast/lunch bags will be available at Reading High School. A lunch meal for that day and a breakfast meal for the next day will be in each of these take-home bags.Â

p.style: color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; text-align: start; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px

span.strong: Meal Pick Up Time and Location

p.style: font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: Schools Days (Monday-Friday)

p.style: font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: Drive through the circle drive to the main entrance. Parents/guardians do not need to get out of your vehicle. Staff will be distributing meal bags to walkers and drivers.

p.style: font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: *The district is expanding its closing time to 12 noon beginning April 13, 2020

p.style: font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px

span.span: Parent Update (4th Quarter Grading Policy): April 23

Although our school building is closed, remote learning is still happening! Our secretaries, teachers, and administrators will be working remotely and checking and responding to emails and voicemails between the hours of 9 a.m. and 3 p.m. on regular school days. Teachers will be corresponding with parents and students on a regular basis.

div.span: The district has set up pages dedicated to guidelines and resources related to remote learning. See the links below.

p.span: Readingâs in-person kindergarten registration procedures have been suspended until further notice. If you are interested in registering your child for kindergarten for 2020-2021, please leave a message or email for Kim Bell at 513-842-5100 or kbell@readingschools.org and arrangements will be made to register your child.

p.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; text-align: start; padding: 0px; margin: 0px

div.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; text-align: start

p.style: color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px

span.span: Because of the COVID-19 crisis in Ohio and our school building being closed,

open enrollment registration will not be accepted in person for the 2020-2021 school yearApplications can be submitted online, dropped off at Reading High School, or mailed. Application forms for new open enrollment students will be accepted for grades Kindergarten â12 starting May 1 through June 1, 2020. Â

p.style: color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px

span.a: Click here to learn more open enrollment and access the application.

p.style: color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: For those families who

in Reading Schools, a letter was mailed from the district on March 16, regarding registration for 2020-2021. The original deadline to return these forms was Friday, March 27. Because of the closure, we are extending the deadline until May 1.

p.style: color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
color: #000000; font-size: 16px; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: Please mail back your blue application with proof of residency to Kim Blair, Reading Community City Schools, 810. E. Columbia Avenue, Reading, OH 45215 or take a photo or scan the application and email it to Mrs. Blairâs attention at
. Mrs. Blair will confirm via email that she has received your application.
Â

span.span: If you have questions regarding open enrollment, please call Kim Blair at 842-5109 or email at
.Â We will be responding to voicemails and emails between the hours of 9 a.m. - 3 p.m. Monday-Friday

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: COVID-19, or coronavirus disease 2019, is an upper respiratory tract disease caused by one of the seven coronaviruses known to infect humans. It was first identified in humans in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China, in December 2019. The virus that causes COVID-19 is called SARS-CoV-2.Â

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Symptoms, which generally appear two to 14 days after exposure, include fever, cough, and difficulty breathing. Most people who become sick do not require hospitalization, but older adults, people with chronic health conditions, and people with compromised immune systems are more likely to require more advanced care.Â

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The virus that causes COVID-19 probably emerged from an animal source, but is now spreading from person to person. The virus is thought to spread mainly between people who are in close contact with one another (within about 6 feet) through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes. It also may be possible that a person can get COVID-19 by touching a surface or object that has the virus on it and then touching their own mouth, nose, or possibly their eyes, but this is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads.Â

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Learn what is known about the spread of newly emerged coronaviruses at

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The CDC has recommended using the following precautions similar to the flu and other illnesses:

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Wash your hands for 20 seconds or more with soapy water, especially after using the restroom, before eating and after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.Â

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Use hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol if soap and water arenât accessible.

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Avoid touching your eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Avoid contact with people who are sick.

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Stay home while you are sick (except to visit a health care professional) and avoid contact with others.

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Cover your mouth/nose with a tissue or sleeve when coughing or sneezing, then throw the tissue in the trash.

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Get adequate sleep and eat well-balanced meals to ensure a healthy immune system.

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Regularly clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Avoid traveling to, or practice enhanced precautions when traveling to high-risk areas identified by the CDC.

span.style: font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
span.span: Talking to Kids About the Coronavirus | Child Mind Institute

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.style: color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: In the coming weeks, many Americans will be affected either directly or indirectly by COVID-19 and Charter is focused on serving and supporting our 29 million customers. To ease the strain in this challenging time, beginning Monday, March 16, Charter commits to the following for 60 days:

p.style: color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: Charter will offer free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college studentsÂ who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription at any service level up to 100 Mbps. To enroll call 1-844-488-8395. Installation fees will be waived for new student households.

div.style: color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

p.span: For eligible low-income households without school-aged children, Charter continues to offer Spectrum Internet Assist, a low-cost broadband program delivering speeds of 30 Mbps.
Charter will open its Wi-Fi hotspots across our footprint for public use.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We encourage you to regularly check these websites for the most up to date information about COVID-19:

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If you have questions about coronavirus, the Ohio Department of Health has set up a call center. You can reach the call center 7 days per week from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. at 1-833-4-ASK-ODH.Â

span.strong: ALERT HCâMASS NOTIFICATION AND WARNING SYSTEM

div.span: Alert Hamilton County (Alert HC) and Smart911 are a joined effort to both notify residents, visitors, and those who work in Hamilton County of emergency situations and other important information, as well as provide an opportunity to create a Safety Profile that can save vital response time during an emergency. With Alert HC, users are able to choose from more than 42 different alerts they may wish to be notified about to keep themselves and their families safe. This system is completely customizable and allows users to choose which alerts they want to receive and how they want to receive them. Alert Hamilton County can notify users via text message, and email, with phone call notification available for the following alerts: Civil Emergency Message, Civil Danger Warning, Evacuation Immediate, Shelter In Place, Tornado Warning, Flash Flood Warning, Flood Warning, and Municipal Alerts.
Click on the link below to sign up for the alerts.

a.span: Remote Learning Plans During Closure for COVID-19
